messages.message: Okay perfect, thanks. Will go back to AXA with the above points, also yes the 'application' in this case is 'Instabase'.
hold up please @Vishnu Nair Kerry and i are revising the first answer

Okay no problem, they need an answer fairly quickly as this information is required to come up with a security testing plan. Have asked for clarification on some of the points which can hopefully help.

ok, proposing these responses:

1. From the perspective of all types of in-scope user roles navigating the application, approximately how many dynamic pages in total are there? *Users interact with approximately 20 distinct single-page apps ("dynamic pages") that generally correspond to the list of "All Apps" within the Instabase app (e.g. Classifier, Flow, Marketplace)*
2. If such web services or remoting endpoints are exposed, how many methods / operations are there? *Instabase apps do not expose underlying web services outside of the app environment, which is controlled by the customer.*
3. For such web services, can documentation or test harnesses detailing how to create well-formed requests be provided? *N/A given that these endpoints are not exposed*
4. On what technologies / programming languages is the application built? (ASP, ASP.NET (http://ASP.NET), J2EE, C/C++, etc) *Java, Python, Go, Typescript*
5. Does the application utilise 3rd party frameworks or APIs? (Dojo, Spring, GWT, etc) *React, Flask, Redis, RabbitMQ, Celery, gRPC, Thrift*

Thanks Jack, just had some clarification from AXA. For the first question they want to know how many pages there are roughly on the application to give them an idea on how long it will take to test each section/page. 1-50, 1-100, 100+ is the kind of answer they expect â€“ an idea on size. For the last question they are happy with our answer for now and will reach out if they need anything more.
Vishnu are you able to share any further context of what they are testing for and how they plan to treat?

Hi Jack, I have no further context. They are using these questions to come up with a scope for testing, once complete it will be shared with myself before anything goes ahead. Once I get this I can send it to yourself.
i don't think this clarification changes our answer. instabase is not a set of static web pages but rather a set of web apps as described.
